DataElement.preferredName: Patient Eligibility Determination Toxicity Recovery Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria regarding recovery from toxicity to eligibility levels.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Eligibility Determination Toxicity Recovery Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Eligibility Determination Toxicity Recovery Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.:The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.:A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient recovered to elig
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to eligibility levels from prior toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to eligibility levels from prior toxicity or adverse events as a result of previous treatment prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events attributable to previous treatment to less than or equal to grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to eligibility levels from prior toxicity or adverse events as a result of previous treatment prior to entering the study (except alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy less than or equal to 4 weeks or 5 half-lives if known prior to enrollment on protocol and has not recovered to eligibility levels from prior toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from the acute toxic effects of prior therapy to a grade 1 (CTCAE v.4.0) level prior to enrollment (does not apply to alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has progressed on treatment with one of the 3 agents being used in this trial or treatment with other checkpoint inhibitors, have they recovered from previous toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from adverse events of previously administered therapeutic agents to Grade 1 or less toxicity according to CTCAE version 5.0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient fully recovered from any acute toxic effects of all prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiotherapy prior to entering this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has treated brain metastases, does patient have disease outside the CNS and has recovered from acute toxicity associated with the treatment to less than or equal to  CTCAE grade 1 or baseline (with the exception of alopecia), with no requirement for escalating doses of corticosteroids over the past 7 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient fully recovered from any acute toxic effects of all prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and/or radiotherapy with toxicities reduced to Grade 1 or less prior to entering this study?
